data.value: This function is experimental and its behaviour is likely to change especially regarding padding of dimension coordinates (or IndexVariables).

When using one of the modes ("edge", "reflect", "symmetric", "wrap"), coordinates will be padded with the same mode, otherwise coordinates are padded using the "constant" mode with fill_value dtypes.NA.
, integer types will be promoted to
Padding coordinates will drop their corresponding index (if any) and will reset default indexes for dimension coordinates.
Mapping with the form of {dim: (pad_before, pad_after)} describing the number of values padded along each dimension. {dim: pad} is a shortcut for pad_before = pad_after = pad

children.type_: mapping of Hashable to tuple of int

data.value: How to pad the DataArray (taken from numpy docs):
"edge": Pads with the edge values of array.
"linear_ramp": Pads with the linear ramp between end_value and the   array edge value.
"maximum": Pads with the maximum value of all or part of the   vector along each axis.
"mean": Pads with the mean value of all or part of the   vector along each axis.
"median": Pads with the median value of all or part of the   vector along each axis.
"minimum": Pads with the minimum value of all or part of the   vector along each axis.
"reflect": Pads with the reflection of the vector mirrored on   the first and last values of the vector along each axis.
"symmetric": Pads with the reflection of the vector mirrored   along the edge of the array.
"wrap": Pads with the wrap of the vector along the axis.   The first values are used to pad the end and the   end values are used to pad the beginning.

Used in 'maximum', 'mean', 'median', and 'minimum'.  Number of values at edge of each axis used to calculate the statistic value. {dim_1: (before_1, after_1), ... dim_N: (before_N, after_N)} unique statistic lengths along each dimension. ((before, after),) yields same before and after statistic lengths for each dimension. (stat_length,) or int is a shortcut for before = after = statistic length for all axes. Default is

children.type_: int, tuple or mapping of Hashable to tuple, default: None

data.value: Used in 'constant'.  The values to set the padded values for each axis.
unique pad constants along each dimension.
yields same before and after constants for each dimension.

children.type_: scalar, tuple or mapping of Hashable to tuple, default: 0

data.value: Used in 'linear_ramp'.  The values used for the ending value of the linear_ramp and that will form the edge of the padded array.
unique end values along each dimension.
yields same before and after end values for each axis.

children.type_: scalar, tuple or mapping of Hashable to tuple, default: 0

data.value: Used in "reflect", and "symmetric". The "even" style is the default with an unaltered reflection around the edge value. For the "odd" style, the extended part of the array is created by subtracting the reflected values from two times the edge value.
DataArray with the padded coordinates and data.
Pad this array along one or more dimensions.

data.out:
<xarray.DataArray (x: 6)>
array([0, 5, 6, 7, 0, 0])
Coordinates:
  * x        (x) float64 nan 0.0 1.0 2.0 nan nan

<xarray.DataArray (x: 4, y: 4)>
array([[nan, nan, nan, nan],
       [ 0.,  1.,  2.,  3.],
       [10., 11., 12., 13.],
       [nan, nan, nan, nan]])
Coordinates:
  * x        (x) float64 nan 0.0 1.0 nan
  * y        (y) int64 10 20 30 40
    z        (x) float64 nan 100.0 200.0 nan

data.value: are coerced to the data type of the array which may lead to a loss of precision:

data.out:
<xarray.DataArray (x: 4, y: 4)>
array([[ 1,  1,  1,  1],
       [ 0,  1,  2,  3],
       [10, 11, 12, 13],
       [ 1,  1,  1,  1]])
Coordinates:
  * x        (x) float64 nan 0.0 1.0 nan
  * y        (y) int64 10 20 30 40
    z        (x) float64 nan 100.0 200.0 nan

signature.value: pad(self: 'T_DataArray', pad_width: 'Mapping[Any, int | tuple[int, int]] | None' = None, mode: 'PadModeOptions' = 'constant', stat_length: 'int | tuple[int, int] | Mapping[Any, tuple[int, int]] | None' = None, constant_values: 'float | tuple[float, float] | Mapping[Any, tuple[float, float]] | None' = None, end_values: 'int | tuple[int, int] | Mapping[Any, tuple[int, int]] | None' = None, reflect_type: 'PadReflectOptions' = None, **pad_width_kwargs: 'Any') -> 'T_DataArray'
